title: تحرشات متعددة فى شارع سراى الجزيرة الزمالك
place: Zamalek - El Gezeera St. (الزمالك - ش الجزيرة)
description:
أنا دايما متعودة أمشى كلابى على الرصيف العريض أمام منزلى فى سراى الجزيرة. فى العموم الشارع امان بس بقالى يومين على التوالى بتعرض لتحرشات متعددة. يوم الاحد الفات تعرضت لأحدا الشباب وكشف عن عضو من أعضاه الجسدية. انا كنت بسه لتحت بحاول اشوف كلبى بيأكا ايه فلاقيت الشاب ده امامى و بيقولى لو سماحتى لو سماحتى و كان واضع ايده على المنطقة الحساسة عنده و تون صوته كان  رفيع و مقزز. الشارع فيى بوليس من عند الماريوت بس انا كنت الناحية التانية  ناحية مركب امبيريال. فا المكان شوية ضلمه و مقيش كان ناس كتير و ده كان الساعة 7:30 مساء يعنى مش متاخر ولا حاجة.
بعديها بيومين,امبارح الأربعاء مجموعة شباب اعترضوا طريقى و انا بمشى كلابى و ابتدوا يستزرقوا و  يعكسوا كلابى و يعترضوا طرقهم. فى المرتين انا عليت صوتى و شتمتهم فمشيوا مسرعين بس الموضوع بقى يضايق بجد

title: a try for abduction in public transportation
description:
today, my friend used the public transportation, she was standing in a very crowded mini bus when a guy got on the bus, stood extremely close to her, she looked at him n said, "stop doing that", he then looked at her n said, while hardly grabbing and pulling her left hand, "well, I'm going down now, r u comin with me?!", she didn't know what to do, so she screamed at him sayin what r u doin n so.
the very strange thing was that the bus was crowded, VERY crowded, n yet, no one did anything to prevent what was happening, instead, some kept watchin in silence, others ignored the whole situation, she even told me that she noticed this one guy chatting with his friend next to him about what's happening, and again, without any reaction, as if they were discussing a movie !
NOTE: the reason why I'm sending in this instead of her is that she is broken down n collapsed right now, to a limit that she can't even think!

title: Sexually harrased :'(
description:
Friday 10/12/2010, something horrible happened to me at the concert of Amr Diab and David Venditta at the FUE!

I was sexually harassed by an officer!

it was very crowded at the entrance, ppl are pushing and pushing and suddenly i was facing like from 6 to 10 officers. the crowd pushed me and i couldn't make any balance, in a Minuit i was standing between the arms of one of them!

I quickly pushed my self away from him and suddenly i didn't see anything like if it was all darkness and one of those bastards put his hand on my private area and started scratching :'(

I screamed and pulled my legs in together and pushed his hands away, he pulled my skirt! ( i was wearing a skirt to my knees with high boots and legenz in between ) i turned around while screaming and tried to get into the crowd to hide between the people, i was veryyyy scarred!!

then they opened the entrance, I ran with ppl and then when i saw my friend I threw my self into her arms and started crying.

This shit never ever happened to me before. its the first time.

It is a horrible thing and a black dot in my life. and every time it pops up in my head i swear to God my hole body shiver and vibrate and I feel the heat all over my body!

I thought officer's job was to protect us from the bastards who might harrase us .. but seems like i was totally wrong!

title: Being Harassed where i live
description:
i live in a closed area, a compound, anyways all people know each other and they are all from the university teaching staff, i am a bit of a loner, i dont like socializing in my compound, its my free choice, i am 20 years old, i have lived here for almost 10 years, guys who live here keep on harassing me not physically but they keep on bullying
one incident:

another incident 5 weeks ago:

title: Catcalls, Following and Throwing Stones
description: I am an American women who lives in Abu Dhabi and recently travelled to Egypt.  Due to my circumstances, the only way for me to visit the Pyramids and the Sphinx was on my own, without friends or a tour group.  Never in my entire life have I felt so scared.  The groups of men were following me and catcalling at me.  Some were yelling disgusting language At me as well.  The worst part of my trip to the pyramids was when a group of middle school age boys threw rocks at me after I gracefully and altruistically took pictures with them.  I was terrified and the police man I encountered did not speak English. It was so unfortunate and disapointing that my life long dream of seeing The Pyramids of Giza was destroyed by a bunch of men and boys who can not control their behavior.

title: Midan Sphinx - Daily Harassment
description: I work in Midan Sphinx, and park my car under 15th of May bridge. The distance I have to walk is less than 100meters, and I get harassed by five different men on average everyday, on my going and return walk. The distance is very small, but the number of comments and ogling I get everyday makes me hate my life and makes me unable to work. It's very difficult to start your day with being harassed, and then finish it with more harassment. I go home after work, and bury myself in bed and I almost never go out.

title: Alexandria - Going to the mall
description:
Hi Guys,
   I'm almost 25 years old. I'm a pretty girl as I guess. Here's my story with sexual harassment. Yasterday I was walking down the street heading the mall to buy some cosmetics. I found some guys standing at the corner of the mall street. It started with I guess flirting comments. So, I didn't care about it, and then I went into the mall they stalked. I wasn't know that till I decided to buy something to drink from the hypermarket inside the mall. The hypermarket wasn't full of poeple at that time, I found them behind me flirting me again. As alwasy I didn't pay attention to them till one of them approached me, and touched my ass [sorry for the abuse]. At that time I screamed ALOUD I couldn't believe myself I was totally missed up.

When the people started gathering around, the boys had run away.  Unfortunately the mall guards couldn't catch them up. When I started to warn my closest friends about this epidemic phenomenon by telling my story they told me about this site to report my situation in hope to kill off this phenomenon.

PS. This happened in San Stefano mall at Metro hypermarket, Alexandria.

Thanks
My regards

title: Harassments in Mohandessin, Cairo, Egypt.
description:
I've been working in Syria st., mohandessin for 4 years now and would like to report a street off Syria that is called Demashk.

In Demashk street all my female colleagues and myself have faced and are still facing all sorts of harassment!! They are basically young school boys that wonder the streets just to waste time, which is really sad cause I wonder what will they do to us when they grow up!

Those kids walk in groups (4 of them) and their age varies from 7 up to 13 years and they are all scary!!

We've been touched, thrown with stones, heard a lot of dirty and sexual invites and comments.. Another incident was 2 guys were riding a motorbike and they were acting as if they want to hit me.. 

This area is close to Sudan st., and Ard el Lewa and has a lot of public schools.. I really wonder what they teach them in those schools!!

At the end of the street is a public school for girls and even those girls harass other girls like me or grown up women, which is even sadder!! 

Last incident was last afternoon at 5:30pm, 4 boys were drinking water of a cooler in the street and when I passed in front of me, one of them spitted water on me.. 

I tried to be brief but I have plenty of humiliating stories and situations only in this area.. I hope this was helpful and that someone will do anything about it..

Thanks a lot..

title: Zamallek Harassment
description:
While I was walking home in Zamallek, a car stopped by. A well dressed man in a Mercedes. He was wondering can he give me a ride, while looking at me like I am low class prostitute.  I ignored him for a second, but than decided I need to do something about it. I turned around, stick my finger out and said: "I want you to go home. Pray for what you have done. Be a good Muslim and not talk to women you don't know." He nodded in agreement and said a good night. I felt proud. 

On purpose I didn't include what I was wearing, as that doesn't matter. The harassment is not conditioned by the outfit a woman wears and it never should be. 
However, on purpose I did include that the man who stopped was wealthy, as I wished to show that the problem is not just concentrated within a curtain class group or even area of the city. It has become deeply rooted within all levels of the Egyptian society.

title: A Film to Die For
description: My sister and I were crossing the street in Manial, you know the one that's on the Nile, heading to Cinema Galaxy.  We looked both ways before we crossed, and it was clear.  Midway in the street, a car comes speeding outrageously at us literally stopping 1 cm or so from our bodies.  As we tried to dodge it, the asshole swerved towards us.  We seriously thought we were gonna get killed and as the two motherfuckers in the car blasted music and said their flirty words, which we could barely focus on from the terrorizing fear, they left and no one on the street reacted as if this was perfectly normal.  This isn't the first time I get into a situation with an asshole operating a vehicle, and it has taught me to carry rocks in my purse...because when this happens, the only thing those pervs do is run off like cowards and you know what...everytime that happens, I pray to God that He makes them pay...not just for me...or my sister...but for every other poor woman who has to put up with this shit everytime she sets foot on the streets of Cairo.

title: Carfull of Pervs in Zamalek
place: Zamalek - Shagaret El Dorr St. (الزمالك - ش شجرة الدر)
description:
Standing on 26th July, dressed professionally, waiting for a friend to pick me up to go to an Opera concert, a car full of 5 men in their 40s slowed in front of me so the driver could lean over and yell something incomprehensible but no doubt obscene, while the others snickered and I raised my hands in a 'what the fuck do you want, are you kidding me?' sort of gesture.  A male bystander also seemed puzzled by their actions and checked to see my reaction sympathetically.  

If professional women simply standing on the sidewalk are made to feel dirty and get treated like prostitutes, what are we to do?  I was so angry, and was annoyed at myself for not reacting more strongly, like fingering him or yelling 'shame on your and your family you piece of shit!'  I'm sure they would all be delighted to have their sisters or mothers treated that way by their countrymen.  Filthy hypocrites.  

What's sad is that nearly every male passing me slowed to ogle and smirk, making me less confident and more angry with every minute.  Is walking around in a fit of offensive rage the answer?
